message: calvetica
Any recommendations? I'd like to have it show multiple events in a day. Week view isn't too important. Nice but not a deal breaker.
@linopolus does calvetica has better notification?
I really like Week Cal. It has landscape views and a nice week view.
@unwrangle I don't know what you call better, so I can't say :)
I guessed anything but original iOS calendar is better... push notification and badge?

I have always used GMails for my calendar and contact lists.  GMail can even be synced across all platforms if set up as an exchange account.  That way any changes made on your devices and or computer/mac software are made on gmail.
@unwrangle Calvetica notifications are pretty much on par with the built-in calendar.

Calvetica has the fastest workflow for adding new events with one or several alarms. It's great if you always create similar events and want an alarm at a predefined time relative to the event. miCal and Week Calendar are two more general alternatives. miCal has great options to add birthday reminders and a nice week view. Week Calendar has quite similar features but looks more like the default iOS Calendar app.
+1 For Calvetica. Super easy, and never fails me. Syncs perfectly using Google.
Calvetica and Agenda.
@hyperjinx
+1 for Week Calendar
+1 for Week Cal. I have been using it for 3-4 months and it is OK.
+1 for Agenda
+1 for MiCal
for a to-do list management (with alarms at due date time) Wunderlist is fine too
Easy Calendar is free today. Normally is $3.99

I have been periodically(!) testing all the promising contenders now and then (miCal, Agenda, Calvetica, Week Calendar, Month Calendar, Muji Calendar, CCal, …). CalenGoo still beats them all, IMHO. You should take some time to configure it, but the effort is highly rewarding, both in terms of workflow and aesthetics. Concerning the latter: graphically it still leaves a little bit to be desired from a professional/perfectionist's view, but the extremely elegant and performative kinetics of the scrolling easily make up for that. Further: by far the best sync (incl. feature integration) with Google Calendar.
I've been pretty happy with calvetica
